page.title: 17Inside Wimbledon Tennis
page.content: Traditionally Wimbledon fortnight means hot, sunny June days,but often the reality is different.Whatever the weather, tourists eat the expensive but delicious strawberries and cream, with cool refreshing iced coffee,in the blue and white tents. Inside the dark green gates of the tennis world "oohs" and "aahs" and enthusiastic clapping are heard when a tennis player makes a daring dive for a hard ball.There is always a buzz of noise.It is only when you are seated in Centre Court that there is absolute silence.To sit in Centre Court you must either own a debenture seat or have bought one through the pools or queue all night. Much easier is to walk leisurely at 5 o'clock avoiding all traffic to pay two or three pounds to enable you to enter the grounds and then spend long lovely evenings of splendid tennis.
